summary: This document is an email chain from March 2021 regarding the organization of a virtual sexual assault prevention conference. It shows attorneys from Edwards Pottinger LLC being invited to present a workshop using the Jeffrey Epstein case as a case study to explain civil litigation for sexual abuse and human trafficking survivors.

events.title: Suffolk County Campus Sexual Assault Prevention Enough is Enough Conference
events.description: A virtual conference held via Zoom featuring workshops on sexual assault prevention, including one using the Jeffrey Epstein case as a case study to explain civil remedies for survivors.

keyFacts: Attorneys from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC were invited to present at a sexual assault prevention conference in April 2021.
The proposed workshop title was 'Civil Litigation of Sexual Abuse Claims â€” Jeffrey Epstein'.
The workshop aimed to use the Jeffrey Epstein case as a case study to explain civil legal remedies for survivors of sexual abuse and human trafficking.
The conference was organized by the Crime Victims Center / Parents for Megan's Law.
The communication shows the Epstein case was being used as an educational tool in professional legal and victim advocacy circles years after the main events.
